title: 'I have some gas left in the tank': At 37, Djokovic still has big tennis goals
description: Djokovic has had a rough start to 2025, but shown flashes of brilliance too. And he's aiming for that 100th tour win.
author: Simon Cambers

title: Pegula, Gauff reach quarterfinals in Stuttgart
description: Jessica Pegula and Coco Gauff cruised into the quarterfinals of the Porsche Grand Prix on Thursday.

title: Alcaraz beats Djere to reach Barcelona Open quarters
description: Top seed Carlos Alcaraz eases into the quarter-finals of the Barcelona Open with a 6-2 6-4 win over Laslo Djere 6-2 6-4.

title: Teenager Andreeva out of Stuttgart Open in last 16
description: In-form Mirra Andreeva exits the Stuttgart Open with 6-3 6-2 loss to fellow Russian Ekaterina Alexandrova in the last 16.

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: What is the Barcelona tennis schedule?
description: Play continues Friday at the Barcelona Open Banc Sabadell, the ATP 500 event in Spain. Among the players headlining the quarter-final action will be top seed Carlos Alcaraz and second seed Casper Ruud. View Friday's full order of play below (how to watch).    ORDER OF PLAY - FRIDAY, 18 APRIL 2025 Pista Rafa Nadal - start 11 a.m. Karen Khachanov vs Alejandro Davidovich Fokina (ESP) [6] Holger Rune (DEN) vs [2] Casper Ruud (NOR) Not Before 4 p.m. [1] Carlos Alcaraz (ESP) vs [5] Alex de Minaur (AUS) Followed By [3] Stefanos Tsitsipas (GRE) vs [7] Arthur Fils (FRA) Pista Andres Gimeno - start 10:30 a.m. [4] Luca Daraban (ROU) vs Teo Casadesus (ESP) Not Before 2 p.m. Alexander Erler (AUT) / Constantin Frantzen (GER) vs Hugo Nys (MON) / John Peers (AUS) Sander Arends (NED) / Luke Johnson (GBR) vs Ariel Behar (URU) / Joran Vliegen (BEL) [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What is the Munich tennis schedule?
description: The BMW Open by Bitpanda continues Friday in Munich. Top seed Alexander Zverev and second seed Ben Shelton headline the action, with semi-final places on the line. View Friday's full order of play below (how to watch).  ORDER OF PLAY - FRIDAY, 18 APRIL 2025 Center Court - start 11:00 a.m. [5] Francisco Cerundolo (ARG) vs David Goffin (BEL) Luciano Darderi (ITA) vs [2] Ben Shelton (USA) [1] Alexander Zverev (GER) vs Tallon Griekspoor (NED) Fabian Marozsan (HUN) vs Zizou Bergs (BEL) Court 1 - start 2 p.m. Andre Goransson (SWE) / Sem Verbeek (NED) vs [WC] Jakob Schnaitter (GER) / Mark Wallner (GER) Para Court - start 11 a.m. Allianz Para Trophy - [1] Alfie Hewett (GBR) vs Joachim Gerard (BEL) Followed By Allianz Para Trophy - Gaetan Menguy (FRA) vs [2] Gustavo Fernandez (ARG) Not Before 1:30 p.m. Allianz Para Trophy - Nico Langmann (AUT) / Christoph Wilke (GER) vs [2] Joachim Gerard (BEL) / Maikel Scheffers (NED) Not Before 3 p.m. Allianz Para Trophy - [1] Alfie Hewett (GBR) / Gordon Reid (GBR) vs Nicolas Charrier (FRA) / Gaetan Menguy (FRA) [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Alcaraz Wins 2025 Monte Carlo Title
description: Carlos Alcaraz claimed his sixth Masters 1000 crown and first Monte-Carlo title on Sunday, overpowering a fading Lorenzo Musetti 3-6, 6-1, 6-0. The Spaniard weathered a fiery first set from Musetti, but the Italian’s right leg buckled in the third, requiring treatment at 0-3. Alcaraz, clinical as ever, seized the moment, wrapping it up in …
author: Jonathan

title: Monte-Carlo Masters 2025 Day 7 Semi-Final Recap
description: Day 7 at the Rolex Monte-Carlo Masters boiled the tournament down to its final two, with Carlos Alcaraz and Lorenzo Musetti earning their spots in Sunday’s championship match. Alcaraz produced a cleaner display to oust Alejandro Davidovich Fokina in an entertaining 7-6(2), 6-4 clash, overcoming a spraying some forehands and five missed match points to …
author: Jonathan
